text: Edmonton Green railway station is in the London Borough of Enfield in north east London, and is in Travelcard Zone 4. It is on the Seven Sisters branch of the Lea Valley Lines. The station is served by London Overground during off peak and peak times and Abellio Greater Anglia during peak times. It is in the centre of Edmonton, London. The station was opened as Edmonton Green on July 22, 1872 and was renamed to Lower Edmonton on July 1, 1883. It reverted to its original name in 1992 to better reflect the name of the area which it serves. It is located close to Edmonton Green shopping centre. It is near the former site of Lower Edmonton (low level) railway station. ==Gallery== Image:Edmonton Green stn look north2.JPG|Looking northbound Image:Edmonton Green stn look south2.JPG|Looking southbound Image:Edmonton Green stn signage.JPG|Signage on southbound platform, July 2008 == References == ==Other websites== * Category:Railway stations in the London Borough of Enfield Category:Railway stations opened in 1872 Category:Railway stations served by National Express East Anglia Category:1872 establishments in England
title: Edmonton Green railway station
